pull.title: p2p: Avoid logging transaction decode errors to stderr
pull.body:
(previous title "p2p: Disallow extended encoding for non-witness transactions (take 3)")

Remote peers can send us illegally encoded txs and thus have us write to stderr. Fix that by not writing to stderr.

This is a follow up to the previous (incomplete) attempts at this:

*  Disallow extended encoding for non-witness transactions #14039 
*  Add test for superfluous witness record in deserialization #15893

verification.payload:
tree 2622d9a764d368dd69159f3ae6c44e6634bfa51e
parent e79bbb73e08e3f191e97d3b67a2fbb510c5545ff
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1557776290 -0400
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1557837235 -0400

Disallow extended encoding for non-witness transactions (take 3)

events.message: Disallow extended encoding for non-witness transactions (take 3)

events.body: utACK fa2b52af32f6a4b9c22c270f36e92960c29ef364. Would change title to something like "Avoid logging transaction decode errors to stderr" instead of "Disallow extended encoding for non-witness transactions." The current title is confusing because this PR isn't really allowing or disallowing anything, just logging the condition differently. "Disallow" also seems to contradict the "Allow exceptions from..." comments in the actual code.

rename.from: p2p: Disallow extended encoding for non-witness transactions (take 3)
rename.to: p2p: Avoid logging transaction decode errors to stderr

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2038,9 +2038,9 @@ def test_witness_sigops(self):
         # TODO: test p2sh sigop counting
 
     def test_superfluous_witness(self):
-        # Serialization of tx that puts witness flag to 1 always
+        # Serialization of tx that puts witness flag to 3 always
         def serialize_with_bogus_witness(tx):
-            flags = 1
+            flags = 3
comments.body: Why's it important that the flag is 3 and not 1? Maybe add a code comment.

comments.body: @thijstriemstra Mind adding a comment to explain the magic number? It should be clear what it does if you try to set it to `0`, `1`, or `2` and run the test (or review the test case)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2038,9 +2038,9 @@ def test_witness_sigops(self):
         # TODO: test p2sh sigop counting
 
     def test_superfluous_witness(self):
-        # Serialization of tx that puts witness flag to 1 always
+        # Serialization of tx that puts witness flag to 3 always
         def serialize_with_bogus_witness(tx):
-            flags = 1
+            flags = 3
comments.body: I can try.. also noticed a lot of if statement with parentheses that are not needed, e.g. `if (len(tx.wit.vtxinwit) != len(tx.vin)):`. Why not `if len(tx.wit.vtxinwit) != len(tx.vin):`? Or is this preferred coding style for Python in this project?

comments.body: We don't have a python coding style (except for the `./test/lint/lint-python.sh`), but without parens is indeed preferred.
